thread.title: Lincoln hero Sean Raggett's tweet from 2012 shows how much he enjoyed beating Joey Barton's Burnley
thread.title_full: Lincoln hero Sean Raggett's tweet from 2012 shows how much he enjoyed beating Joey Barton's Burnley

author: Mark Jones
title: Lincoln hero Sean Raggett's tweet from 2012 shows how much he enjoyed beating Joey Barton's Burnley
text:
Sport Lincoln hero Sean Raggett's tweet from 2012 shows how much he enjoyed beating Joey Barton's Burnley The defender's 89th minute winner at Turf Moor got people talking on Saturday afternoon, but it was something he said five years ago which was most telling Share Raggett didn't quite predict the future (Photo: Reuters) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Lincoln City's shock win at Burnley was described as a dream result, but the man who scored their winning goal had been dreaming about it already. 
Defender Sean Raggett's 89th minute header which *just* crossed the line was met with wild celebrations from the Imps fans and indeed most neutral observers, as Lincoln became the first non-league side to reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup in 103 years. 
And for Raggett, it was particularly special. The moment a dream came true (Photo: AFP) Raggett in the centre of the celebrations (Photo: Clive Brunskill) 
Because it seems as though the centre-back isn't a huge fan of Joey Barton. 
The Burnley firebrand was the subject of a tweet from Raggett way back in June 2012, which read: "I hope I get to play against Joey Barton one day #dream #kneehightackles." 
And while the 23-year-old didn't go through with his promise when up against Barton - who spent most of the game winding up Raggett's teammates and pretty much everyone else - he instead inflicted a much more painful punishment on him in the form of the winning goal. Joey didn't have a day to remember (Photo: REUTERS) 
Which for Lincoln - and everyone who doesn't like Barton very much - was a much better thing to do. All together now...
